title: L’articolo 21 nella gabbia di Facebook - Terzogiornale
Facebook premia gli estremisti: la ricerca dell'Università di Urbino - Lumsanews
Il Premio Rimini Mundi a sette ambasciatori del congressuale - lapiazzarimini.it
Advancing Research on Disinformation and Digital Manipulation: The University of Urbino at two Key Conferences in Brazil – vera.ai VERification Assisted by Artificial Intelligence
snippet: Professor Fabio Giglietto presented collaborative research with Dr. Giada Marino and Bruna Paroni that explores an innovative approach to analyzing political discourse: using fine-tuned large language models (LLMs) to examine political talk in hyperpartisan Facebook groups. On Friday, 17 October, Fabio Giglietto moderated a roundtable discussion on "Ruptures in Data Access: The State of Social Media Research APIs & Tools in the DSA Era".
description: This article on vera.ai discusses Professor Fabio Giglietto's presentation and moderation of a roundtable at conferences in Brazil, focusing on disinformation, digital manipulation, and challenges in social media research during the DSA era.

title: Il movimento religioso cinese che si è infiltrato in un gruppo Facebook urbinate - ilducato.it
A project on coordinated behavior at the Digital Methods Summer School and Data Sprint 2024 - Nicola Righetti
snippet: This page refers to Fabio Giglietto's research on the propagation of disinformation through coordinated behavior.
description: This page from the Digital Methods Summer School and Data Sprint 2024 discusses a project related to coordinated behavior and explicitly mentions Fabio Giglietto's research on disinformation.

title: Who is behind vera.ai? Meet the people and teams that make up the vera.ai project. #8 Team of University of Urbino Carlo Bo
snippet: This article introduces the University of Urbino Carlo Bo team involved in the vera.ai project, led by Fabio Giglietto. It discusses their role in discovering potentially problematic content in near-real-time using a content-agnostic approach, focusing on coordinated sharing behavior.
description: This article from vera.ai introduces the University of Urbino Carlo Bo team involved in the vera.ai project, led by Fabio Giglietto, and their role in identifying problematic online content.
